czar.gloss: a male monarch or emperor (especially of Russia prior to 1917)

czar alexander i.gloss: the czar of Russia whose plans to liberalize the government of Russia were unrealized because of the wars with Napoleon (1777-1825)

czar alexander ii.gloss: the son of Nicholas I who, as czar of Russia, introduced reforms that included limited emancipation of the serfs (1818-1881)

czar alexander iii.gloss: son of Alexander II who was czar of Russia (1845-1894)

czar nicholas i.gloss: czar of Russia from 1825 to 1855 who led Russia into the Crimean War (1796-1855)

czar peter i.gloss: czar of Russia who introduced ideas from western Europe to reform the government

czarina.gloss: the wife or widow of a czar

czaritza.gloss: the wife or widow of a czar

czech.gloss: a native or inhabitant of the former republic of Czechoslovakia
of or relating to Czechoslovakia or its people or their language

czech capital.gloss: the capital and largest city of the Czech Republic in the western part of the country

czechoslovak.gloss: a native or inhabitant of the former republic of Czechoslovakia

czechoslovakian.gloss: a native or inhabitant of the former republic of Czechoslovakia
of or relating to Czechoslovakia or its people or their language

czerny.gloss: Austrian virtuoso pianist and composer of many works for the piano

czarist.gloss: of or relating to or characteristic of a czar

czaristic.gloss: of or relating to or characteristic of a czar
